etymology.description: semantic: 彳(彳) (chì, "step") + phonetic: 殳(殳) (shū, "weapon") = moving with a weapon -> military service
etymology.interpretation: The character 役(yì) combines 彳 (chì, "step"), suggesting movement or marching, with 殳 (shū, "weapon"), indicating martial activity, to conceptually form the idea of military service or a campaign.

examples.chinese: 他服役已经三年了(他服役已經三年了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā fú yì yǐ jīng sān nián le.
examples.english: He has served in the military for three years.

examples.chinese: 政府推行义务役制度(政府推行義務役制度)，鼓励年轻人参军(鼓勵年輕人參軍)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèng fǔ tuī xíng yì wù yì zhì dù, gǔ lì nián qīng rén cān jūn.
examples.english: The government implements the compulsory military service system and encourages young people to join the army.

examples.chinese: 史书记载的一次大役改变了历史(史書記載的一次大役改變了歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Shǐ shū jì zǎi de yī cì dà yì gǎi biàn le lì shǐ.
examples.english: Historical records note that a major military campaign changed history.
